column1: #Text=Bush starts off Africa trip in Benin

#Text=U.S. President George W. Bush , accompanied by his wife Laura , began his five-nation trip to Africa today in Benin , where he met with President Yayi Boni and participated in a joint press conference .
#Text=This is Bush 's second visit to Africa and the first time any US president has visited Benin .
#Text=Topics that were discussed included malaria , cotton , and the crises in Kenya and Darfur .

#Text=At the press conference , held at Cadjehoun International Airport in Cotonou , Yayi thanked Bush for coming to visit and praised him for his " great concern for Africa , its well being , and of the development of its people .

#Text= Kenya is an issue ... and that 's why I 'm sending Secretary Rice there to help the Kofi Annan initiative - all aimed at having a clear message that there be no violence and that there ought to be a power-sharing agreement , " said Bush .

column1: #Text=White House national security adviser Stephen Hadley said Rice 's visit will only last a few hours .
#Text=" It 's basically to go in , give some impetus , but then step out and let Kofi Annan continue his diplomacy , " he said .
#Text=At a press briefing aboard Air Force One , one reporter questioned what could be accomplished in a few hours and asked why the President did n't go to Kenya instead .
#Text=Ambassador Jendayi Frazer answered with , " Secretary Rice 's engagement on Kenya has been much longer than a few hours .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=The purpose of her going is to back Kofi 's mediation , it 's not to take over that mediation ,  Frazer continued .
